verses.verse: Then sang<WH7891> Deborah<WH1683> and Barak<WH1301> the son<WH1121> of Abinoam<WH42> on that day<WH3117>, saying<WH559>,
Praise<WH1288> ye the LORD<WH3068> for the avenging<WH6544><WH6546> of Israel<WH3478>, when the people<WH5971> willingly offered<WH5068> themselves.

Hear<WH8085>, O ye kings<WH4428>; give ear<WH238>, O ye princes<WH7336>; I, even I, will sing<WH7891> unto the LORD<WH3068>; I will sing<WH2167> praise to the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>.

LORD<WH3068>, when thou wentest out<WH3318> of Seir<WH8165>, when thou marchedst out<WH6805> of the field<WH7704> of Edom<WH123>, the earth<WH776> trembled<WH7493>, and the heavens<WH8064> dropped<WH5197>, the clouds<WH5645> also dropped<WH5197> water<WH4325>.
The mountains<WH2022> melted<WH5140> from before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068>, even that Sinai<WH5514> from before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>.

In the days<WH3117> of Shamgar<WH8044> the son<WH1121> of Anath<WH6067>, in the days<WH3117> of Jael<WH3278>, the highways<WH734> were unoccupied<WH2308>, and the travellers<WH1980> walked<WH3212> through byways<WH6128><WH5410>.
The inhabitants of the villages<WH6520> ceased<WH2308>, they ceased<WH2308> in Israel<WH3478>, until that I Deborah<WH1683> arose<WH6965>, that I arose<WH6965> a mother<WH517> in Israel<WH3478>.
They chose<WH977> new<WH2319> gods<WH430>; then was war<WH3901> in the gates<WH8179>: was there a shield<WH4043> or spear<WH7420> seen<WH7200> among forty<WH705> thousand<WH505> in Israel<WH3478>?
My heart<WH3820> is toward the governors<WH2710> of Israel<WH3478>, that offered themselves willingly<WH5068> among the people<WH5971>. Bless<WH1288> ye the LORD<WH3068>.
Speak<WH7878>, ye that ride<WH7392> on white<WH6715> asses<WH860>, ye that sit<WH3427> in judgment<WH4055>, and walk<WH1980> by the way<WH1870>.

They that are delivered from the noise<WH6963> of archers<WH2686> in the places of drawing water<WH4857>, there shall they rehearse<WH8567> the righteous acts<WH6666> of the LORD<WH3068>, even the righteous acts<WH6666> toward the inhabitants of his villages<WH6520> in Israel<WH3478>: then shall the people<WH5971> of the LORD<WH3068> go down<WH3381> to the gates<WH8179>.

Awake<WH5782>, awake<WH5782>, Deborah<WH1683>: awake<WH5782>, awake<WH5782>, utter<WH1696> a song<WH7892>: arise<WH6965>, Barak<WH1301>, and lead thy captivity<WH7628> captive<WH7617>, thou son<WH1121> of Abinoam<WH42>.
Then he made him that remaineth<WH8300> have dominion<WH7287> over the nobles<WH117> among the people<WH5971>: the LORD<WH3068> made me have dominion<WH7287> over the mighty<WH1368>.

Out of Ephraim<WH669> was there a root<WH8328> of them against Amalek<WH6002>; after<WH310> thee, Benjamin<WH1144>, among thy people<WH5971>; out of Machir<WH4353> came down<WH3381> governors<WH2710>, and out of Zebulun<WH2074> they that handle<WH4900> the pen<WH7626> of the writer<WH5608>.

And the princes<WH8269> of Issachar<WH3485> were with Deborah<WH1683>; even Issachar<WH3485>, and also Barak<WH1301>: he was sent<WH7971> on foot<WH7272> into the valley<WH6010>. For the divisions<WH6390> of Reuben<WH7205> there were great<WH1419> thoughts<WH2711> of heart<WH3820>.

Why abodest<WH3427> thou among<WH996> the sheepfolds<WH4942>, to hear<WH8085> the bleatings<WH8292> of the flocks<WH5739>? For the divisions<WH6390> of Reuben<WH7205> there were great<WH1419> searchings<WH2714> of heart<WH3820>.

Gilead<WH1568> abode<WH7931> beyond<WH5676> Jordan<WH3383>: and why did Dan<WH1835> remain<WH1481> in ships<WH591>? Asher<WH836> continued<WH3427> on the sea<WH3220> shore<WH2348>, and abode<WH7931> in his breaches<WH4664>.
Zebulun<WH2074> and Naphtali<WH5321> were a people<WH5971> that jeoparded<WH2778> their lives<WH5315> unto the death<WH4191> in the high places<WH4791> of the field<WH7704>.

The kings<WH4428> came<WH935> and fought<WH3898>, then fought<WH3898> the kings<WH4428> of Canaan<WH3667> in Taanach<WH8590> by the waters<WH4325> of Megiddo<WH4023>; they took<WH3947> no gain<WH1215> of money<WH3701>.
They fought<WH3898> from heaven<WH8064>; the stars<WH3556> in their courses<WH4546> fought<WH3898> against Sisera<WH5516>.
The river<WH5158> of Kishon<WH7028> swept them away<WH1640>, that ancient<WH6917> river<WH5158>, the river<WH5158> Kishon<WH7028>. O my soul<WH5315>, thou hast trodden down<WH1869> strength<WH5797>.
Then were the horsehoofs<WH6119><WH5483> broken<WH1986> by the means of the pransings<WH1726>, the pransings<WH1726> of their mighty ones<WH47>.

Curse<WH779> ye Meroz<WH4789>, said<WH559> the angel<WH4397> of the LORD<WH3068>, curse<WH779> ye bitterly<WH779> the inhabitants<WH3427> thereof; because they came<WH935> not to the help<WH5833> of the LORD<WH3068>, to the help<WH5833> of the LORD<WH3068> against the mighty<WH1368>.
Blessed<WH1288> above women<WH802> shall Jael<WH3278> the wife<WH802> of Heber<WH2268> the Kenite<WH7017> be, blessed<WH1288> shall she be above women<WH802> in the tent<WH168>.
He asked<WH7592> water<WH4325>, and she gave<WH5414> him milk<WH2461>; she brought forth<WH7126> butter<WH2529> in a lordly<WH117> dish<WH5602>.

She put<WH7971> her hand<WH3027> to the nail<WH3489>, and her right hand<WH3225> to the workmen's<WH6001> hammer<WH1989>; and with the hammer she smote<WH1986> Sisera<WH5516>, she smote off<WH4277> his head<WH7218>, when she had pierced<WH4272> and stricken through<WH2498> his temples<WH7541>.

At her feet<WH7272> he bowed<WH3766>, he fell<WH5307>, he lay down<WH7901>: at her feet<WH7272> he bowed<WH3766>, he fell<WH5307>: where<WH834> he bowed<WH3766>, there he fell down<WH5307> dead<WH7703>.

The mother<WH517> of Sisera<WH5516> looked<WH8259> out at a window<WH2474>, and cried<WH2980> through the lattice<WH822>, Why is his chariot<WH7393> so long<WH954> in coming<WH935>? why tarry<WH309> the wheels<WH6471> of his chariots<WH4818>?
Her wise<WH2450> ladies<WH8282> answered<WH6030> her, yea, she returned<WH7725> answer<WH561> to herself,

Have they not sped<WH4672>? have they not divided<WH2505> the prey<WH7998>; to every<WH7218> man<WH1397> a damsel<WH7356> or two<WH7361>; to Sisera<WH5516> a prey<WH7998> of divers colours<WH6648>, a prey<WH7998> of divers colours<WH6648> of needlework<WH7553>, of divers colours<WH6648> of needlework on both sides<WH7553>, meet for the necks<WH6677> of them that take the spoil<WH7998>?

So let all thine enemies<WH341> perish<WH6>, O LORD<WH3068>: but let them that love<WH157> him be as the sun<WH8121> when he goeth forth<WH3318> in his might<WH1369>. And the land<WH776> had rest<WH8252> forty<WH705> years<WH8141>.
